Description: Tondo and base sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery stemless cup; interior black; stamped: central rosette with band of tongues around; underside black (flaked off): two raised rings and raised ring at junction of lip and wall; space within inner ring reserved, with three brown circles (centre damaged).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1556)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
